lessons.title: The Calling and Core of Christian Life Coaching
outline: Defining the distinct differences between Christian Life Coaching, Biblical Counseling, and Secular Coaching.
The Biblical mandate: Exploring the scriptural foundations for exhortation, discipleship, and iron-sharpening-iron relationships.
The Role of the Holy Spirit: Understanding how to yield to the 'Primary Coach' during a session.
Professional Standards: An introduction to the ethics and core competencies required for the Certified Christian Life Coach™ designation.
The Covenant Model: Shifting from a transactional service to a transformation-focused, spirit-led partnership.

lessons.title: Introduction to The C.H.R.I.S.T. Coaching Method™
outline: Methodology Overview: A deep dive into the 6 pillars (Connection, Heart-Search, Revelation, Identity, Stewardship, Transformation).
The Theology of Change: How the CHRIST Method aligns biblical truth with modern behavioral science.
Sequence and Flow: Understanding how the methodology provides a roadmap from the initial prayerful connection to sustainable lifestyle change.
Integrating Scripture: Practical ways to weave biblical insight into the coaching process without becoming 'preachy'.
Expected Outcomes: Defining what success looks like for both the coach and the client using this framework.

lessons.title: The Coach’s Heart: Spiritual Alignment and Ethics
outline: The Internal Landscape: Why the coach's own 'Heart-Search' and spiritual disciplines are prerequisites for effective ministry.
Establishing Spiritual Authority: Walking in humility, integrity, and the power of a surrendered life.
Ethical Boundaries: Navigating confidentiality, dual relationships, and knowing when to refer a client to a licensed therapist or pastor.
The Ministry of Presence: Developing the spiritual gift of active, empathetic listening to discern what is not being said.
Biblical Stewardship of the Coaching Role: Managing the influence and trust placed in you by the client.

lessons.title: Defining Your Coaching Vision and Career Path
outline: Identifying Your Niche: Discerning which specific 'part of the Body' you are called to serve (e.g., leadership, marriage, transitions).
The 5-Year Vision: Mapping out the professional and spiritual growth milestones of your coaching practice.
Market Dynamics: Analyzing the current demand for faith-integrated coaching in a secularized world.
The Path to Mastery: Understanding the L1, L2, and L3 certification tiers and how they build specialized expertise.
Actionable Goal Setting: Creating a 'Stewardship Plan' for your time and resources during this certification program.

lessons.title: The Theology of Connection: A Biblical Foundation
outline: Point 1: Defining 'Connection' within the C.H.R.I.S.T. Coaching Method™ framework.
Point 2: Biblical basis for partnership: Exploring Ecclesiastes 4:9-12 and the 'threefold cord'.
Point 3: The difference between secular rapport-building and spiritual connection.
Point 4: Establishing the coach as a 'paraclete' (helper) under the guidance of the Holy Spirit.
Point 5: The priority of God's presence as the primary connector in the coaching relationship.

lessons.title: Covenant vs. Contract: The Nature of the Partnership
outline: Point 1: Understanding the 'Covenant-Based' partnership model in Christian coaching.
Point 2: Moving beyond transactional agreements to transformational commitments.
Point 3: The role of integrity and 'Hesed' (steadfast love) in professional coaching.
Point 4: Establishing mutual expectations for growth, honesty, and spiritual accountability.
Point 5: How a covenantal mindset creates a safety net for client vulnerability.

lessons.title: Spiritual Alignment and Discernment
outline: Point 1: Assessing spiritual readiness and alignment during the initial consultation.
Point 2: Identifying shared biblical values while respecting denominational diversity.
Point 3: Recognizing 'Red Flags': When a client's spiritual state requires referral rather than coaching.
Point 4: The 'Discernment Filter': Using prayer to sense if the partnership is God-ordained.
Point 5: Navigating the 'Discovery Call' to ensure a match in vision and purpose.

lessons.title: Christ-Like Empathy and Active Listening
outline: Point 1: Listening with the 'ears of the heart': Moving beyond surface-level hearing.
Point 2: Modeling Christ’s compassion (Matthew 9:36) without absorbing the client's emotional weight.
Point 3: The power of 'Holy Silence': Allowing space for the Holy Spirit to speak between words.
Point 4: Non-verbal communication and the 'Ministry of Presence' in a digital or physical space.
Point 5: Techniques for mirroring and validation that honor the client’s dignity in Christ.

lessons.title: Prayer as the Foundation of the Intake Process
outline: Point 1: Integrating prayer naturally into the first session without it feeling forced.
Point 2: The 'Collaborative Prayer' technique: Inviting the client to lead or participate in the opening.
Point 3: Using prayer as a diagnostic tool to reveal underlying client anxieties or hopes.
Point 4: Teaching the client to 'connect upward' before 'connecting inward' during the session.
Point 5: Practical templates for opening and closing sessions with spiritual authority.

lessons.title: Healthy Boundaries and Ethical Stewardship
outline: Point 1: The biblical mandate for boundaries: Stewardship of the coach’s heart and time.
Point 2: Differentiating coaching from counseling, mentoring, and spiritual direction.
Point 3: Establishing 'Connection Limits': Managing availability, messaging, and emergency protocols.
Point 4: The ethics of confidentiality within a spiritual and legal framework.
Point 5: Preventing 'Spiritual Codependency': Keeping the client’s primary dependency on God.

lessons.title: Creating a Sacred Space for Vulnerability
outline: Point 1: The 'Sacred Space' concept: Preparing the physical and mental environment for connection.
Point 2: Removing digital and psychological distractions to honor the client and God.
Point 3: Using language that fosters safety, grace, and non-judgmental exploration.
Point 4: The 'Grace-First' approach: Establishing a culture where 'it’s okay to not be okay'.
Point 5: Environmental factors (lighting, privacy, technology) that support or hinder spiritual connection.

lessons.title: Managing the Three-Way Connection
outline: Point 1: The 'Three-Way' Connection Model: Coach, Client, and Holy Spirit.
Point 2: Relinquishing control: Learning to follow the Spirit’s lead rather than a rigid agenda.
Point 3: Recognizing 'Divine Nudges' and intuitive prompts during the connection phase.
Point 4: Transitioning from Connection (C) to Heart-Search (H): The bridge to deeper exploration.
Point 5: Reviewing the 'Connection Checklist' before moving into the next phase of the method.

lessons.title: Foundations of Biblical Heart-Search
outline: Defining 'Heart-Search' through the lens of Psalm 139:23-24 and Proverbs 20:27.
Distinguishing between secular psychological introspection and Spirit-led heart examination.
The coach's role as a facilitator of the Holy Spirit’s searching rather than a judge.
Creating a 'Safe Haven' environment for deep vulnerability and spiritual honesty.
Biblical anthropology: Understanding the heart as the seat of will, intellect, and emotion.

lessons.title: Identifying Core Beliefs and Internal Narratives
outline: The relationship between internal beliefs and external behavior (Proverbs 23:7).
Techniques for surfacing 'hidden' beliefs that contradict the Word of God.
Differentiating between 'Head Knowledge' (intellectual) and 'Heart Conviction' (experiential).
Mapping the client's internal dialogue and identifying recurring themes of unbelief.
The impact of cultural and familial narratives on the formation of the heart's posture.

lessons.title: The Role of Emotions in Spiritual Discernment
outline: Understanding emotions as 'indicators' of heart health rather than 'dictators' of truth.
Tracking emotional triggers back to their root causes and spiritual origins.
The difference between godly sorrow leading to life and worldly grief leading to death (2 Corinthians 7:10).
Validating the client's emotional experience without validating false conclusions drawn from them.
Helping clients process 'holy discontent' versus 'anxious striving' in their goals.

lessons.title: Unmasking Spiritual Strongholds and Barriers
outline: Biblical definition of a stronghold and how it affects the coaching process (2 Corinthians 10:4-5).
Identifying the 'Big Four' common strongholds: Fear, Rejection, Pride, and Unforgiveness.
How spiritual strongholds create cognitive 'blind spots' in the client’s perspective.
The coach’s role in pointing out inconsistencies between a client's claims and their heart-posture.
Distinguishing between character flaws, biological factors, and spiritual strongholds.

lessons.title: The Power of Motive: Why We Do What We Do
outline: Evaluating the 'Heart’s Desire' vs. the 'Heart’s Demand' in goal setting.
Identifying 'Idols of the Heart' and their influence on client decision-making.
Moving the client from performance-based living to grace-motivated action.
The 'Five Whys' technique adapted for Christian coaching to reach the spiritual root.
Discerning between God-given ambition and ego-driven striving for significance.

lessons.title: Exploring Past Wounds and Limiting Patterns
outline: The impact of past traumas and 'Soul Ties' on current spiritual and professional growth.
Identifying repetitive cycles of failure or stagnation that signal an unhealed heart issue.
Biblical principles for addressing generational patterns and 'the sins of the fathers.'
The necessity of forgiveness as a prerequisite for a successful Heart-Search phase.
Navigating the ethical boundary between coaching and clinical therapy in trauma contexts.

lessons.title: Utilizing Prayerful Inquiry in the Coaching Session
outline: The art of the 'Spirit-Led Question': Listening for the Holy Spirit's prompt during inquiry.
Structuring intentional silence to allow the Holy Spirit to speak directly to the client's heart.
Using 'The Mirror' technique: Reflecting heart-postures and attitudes back to the client.
Transitioning the conversation from surface-level symptoms to root-level heart matters.
Biblical examples of Jesus’s heart-searching questions to the disciples and Pharisees.

lessons.title: Moving from Insight to Surrender
outline: The danger of 'Insight without Action': Avoiding the trap of spiritual intellectualism.
Facilitating a moment of 'Confession and Repentance' within a coaching context.
The transition from 'H' (Heart-Search) to 'R' (Revelation): Preparing for God's perspective.
Helping clients yield their heart-search findings to the Lordship of Jesus Christ.
Summarizing Heart-Search findings to build a foundation for the transformation plan.

lessons.title: Defining Revelation in the C.H.R.I.S.T. Method
outline: The theological definition of revelation vs. its application in life coaching
Distinguishing between general revelation (creation) and special revelation (the Word)
The coach’s role as a facilitator of divine insight rather than a mediator
Shifting the client's focus from human logic (1 Cor 2:14) to spiritual wisdom
The objective of the 'R' phase: Transitioning from 'what I think' to 'what God says'

lessons.title: The Holy Spirit as the Primary Counselor
outline: Understanding the 'Paracletos' (Advocate/Counselor) in a professional coaching context
Practical session opening techniques to invite the Spirit’s presence
Recognizing the 'still small voice' during active coaching dialogue
Balancing professional coaching competencies with spiritual dependency
Maintaining ethical boundaries while following spiritual promptings

lessons.title: Scriptural Alignment: The Ultimate Filter
outline: The principle of Sola Scriptura: Ensuring all 'revelations' align with the Bible
Using the Word to challenge limiting beliefs identified in the Heart-Search phase
Developing a 'Scripture Bank' for common coaching themes (anxiety, career, relationships)
Teaching clients the art of Biblical meditation as a tool for clarity
How to avoid 'proof-texting' or misapplying verses to fit a client's desires

lessons.title: Discernment: Distinguishing the Three Voices
outline: The Voice of Self: Identifying ego, fear-based thinking, and cultural conditioning
The Voice of the Enemy: Recognizing patterns of accusation, confusion, and condemnation
The Voice of God: Characteristics of peace, conviction, and alignment with His nature
The 'Peace Rule' (Colossians 3:15) as a primary discernment tool in decision making
Practical exercises for helping clients filter internal noise

lessons.title: Practical Techniques for Seeking Divine Clarity
outline: The 'Listening Prayer' technique: A step-by-step guide for coaches and clients
Utilizing 'Sacred Silence' within a coaching session to allow for reflection
Journaling as a diagnostic tool for capturing and testing spiritual insights
The role of fasting and consecrated time in the coaching journey
Helping clients ask 'God-ward' questions instead of 'Why me?' questions

lessons.title: Identifying God’s 'Rhema' Word for the Season
outline: The distinction between Logos (the written Word) and Rhema (the specific spoken Word)
Helping clients identify their 'Anchor Verse' for their current life transition
Validating revelation through the 'Three-Fold Witness' (Word, Spirit, and Circumstance)
How to handle subjective 'feelings' that contradict objective Biblical truth
Case studies on 'Rhema' moments that shifted a client's trajectory

lessons.title: Navigating Spiritual Silence and 'Dark Nights'
outline: Coaching strategies for seasons where God seems silent or distant
Understanding the 'Waiting Room': Lessons in patience, trust, and character development
Differentiating between spiritual warfare, divine pauses, and the consequences of sin
Encouraging clients to lean on 'past revelations' when current clarity is lacking
Maintaining momentum in the coaching process during a spiritual plateau

lessons.title: Integrating Revelation into the Coaching Plan
outline: Synthesizing Heart-Search findings with new Divine Revelations
Formatting 'Revelation Statements' for client accountability and focus
Preparing for the 'Identity' phase: How revelation reshapes self-perception in Christ
Moving from a 'problem-focused' agenda to a 'promise-focused' coaching roadmap
Documenting spiritual breakthroughs to track long-term growth and faithfulness

lessons.title: The Theology of Identity: Imago Dei and New Creation
outline: Understanding 'Imago Dei': Exploring the foundational truth that every client is created in the image of God.
The 'New Creation' paradigm: Analyzing 2 Corinthians 5:17 and its implications for coaching transformation.
Positional vs. Experiential Truth: Teaching clients to distinguish between their eternal standing and temporary feelings.
The impact of the Fall on self-perception and the restorative power of the Gospel in the coaching room.

lessons.title: Identity vs. Performance: Breaking the 'Doing' Trap
outline: The Performance Trap: Identifying how clients tie their worth to productivity, success, or ministry output.
Grace-Based Identity: Coaching clients to accept their value as a gift rather than an achievement.
The Martha vs. Mary Paradigm: Helping clients move from 'working for God' to 'walking with God.'
Reframing failure: Using identity-based coaching to help clients recover from setbacks without losing self-worth.

lessons.title: The 'In Christ' Realities: Biblical Affirmations
outline: The Doctrine of Adoption: Exploring the legal and spiritual benefits of being a co-heir with Christ.
Justification and Sanctification: Explaining how 'being right with God' changes a client's daily confidence.
The 'Sealing' of the Spirit: Coaching clients on the security and permanence of their identity in God's kingdom.
Scriptural Declaration: Practical exercises for clients to internalize their 'In Christ' status through word and meditation.

lessons.title: Dismantling False Identities and Labels
outline: Identifying 'Stronghold Labels': Uncovering negative identities inherited from family, culture, or past trauma.
The Psychology of the 'Old Man': Understanding why clients cling to outdated, limiting self-narratives.
The Renovation of the Mind: Coaching techniques for replacing lies with the 'Mind of Christ.'
Breaking the Imposter Syndrome: Addressing the spiritual roots of feeling like a fraud in one’s calling.

lessons.title: Spiritual Authority and Positional Power
outline: Seated in Heavenly Places: Unpacking Ephesians 2:6 as a foundational concept for coaching confidence.
The Coach’s Authority: Understanding your spiritual standing when interceding for and guiding a client.
Exercising Authority over Fear: Teaching clients to use their identity to resist spiritual and emotional intimidation.
The Armor of God as Identity: Viewing the spiritual armor not as tools to pick up, but as an identity to put on.

lessons.title: Uncovering Unique Design: Gifts, Talents, and Temperament
outline: The D.E.S.I.G.N. Framework: Assessing Desire, Experiences, Spiritual Gifts, Individual Style, Growth, and Natural Talents.
Spiritual Gifts in Coaching: Helping clients identify their primary 'Charismata' for kingdom service.
The Role of Personality: Integrating psychological assessments (like DISC or Enneagram) through a biblical lens.
The 'Body of Christ' Principle: Coaching clients to find their specific 'fit' within the larger community of faith.

lessons.title: The Renewed Self-Image: Mirroring the Master
outline: The Mirror of the Word: Using James 1:22-25 to teach clients how to see their true selves in Scripture.
Healing the 'Broken Mirror': Addressing body image, self-hatred, and physical insecurities through identity coaching.
The Role of Community: How the 'one anothers' in Scripture help reinforce and reflect a client’s true identity.
Developing a Personal Identity Statement: A practical tool for clients to summarize their worth and purpose.

lessons.title: From Identity to Impact: The Bridge to Stewardship
outline: Identity as the Engine: Explaining why 'Who I Am' must always precede 'What I Do.'
The Confidence of Calling: How a secure identity empowers clients to take holy risks and set ambitious goals.
Preparing for Stewardship: Shifting the focus from internal realization to external responsibility (The 'S' in CHRIST).
Module Synthesis: Integrating Connection, Heart-Search, and Revelation into a unified Identity-based action plan.

lessons.title: The Theology of Stewardship: From Ownership to Management
outline: Defining Biblical Stewardship: The shift from 'owner' to 'fiduciary manager' of God's resources.
The 'All belongs to God' principle: Analyzing Psalm 24:1 and its implications for coaching.
The Parable of the Talents (Matthew 25): Lessons on ROI (Return on Investment) for the Kingdom.
Differentiating between 'Stewardship' and 'Control' in the client's mindset.
Establishing the coach's role as a stewardship partner rather than a taskmaster.

lessons.title: The Stewardship Audit: Assessing Time, Talent, and Treasure
outline: Conducting a 'Resource Inventory' to identify God-given assets and current allocations.
The 168-Hour Audit: Helping clients track time to reveal hidden priorities and 'time leaks'.
Identifying Spiritual Gifts and Natural Talents: Tools for assessing unique 'Kingdom Capital'.
Financial Stewardship Basics: Aligning spending and saving with biblical values.
Evaluating 'Influence Capital': Mapping the client's current sphere of influence and relationships.

lessons.title: Strategic Goal Setting: Aligning Action with Divine Revelation
outline: The Bridge from Revelation (R) to Stewardship (S): Translating spiritual insight into concrete goals.
The S.M.A.R.T.G. Framework: Adding 'God-Centered' and 'Grace-Based' criteria to traditional goal setting.
Prioritization Strategies: Determining what is 'Good' vs. what is 'Best' for the current season.
Breaking down 'God-Sized' visions into manageable, stewardship-focused micro-steps.
The 'Pruning' Process: Identifying activities or commitments that must be cut to allow for growth.

lessons.title: Time Management as a Sacred Trust
outline: The Theology of Rest: Implementing Sabbath as a core component of effective stewardship.
The 'Eisenhower Matrix' for Christian Coaches: Distinguishing between the urgent and the eternal.
Boundary Setting: The power of a 'Holy No' to protect God-given priorities.
Combating the 'Hurry Sickness': Cultivating a pace of life that allows for spiritual sensitivity.
Practical scheduling tools for maintaining a prayer-first daily routine.

lessons.title: Stewardship of the Temple: Health, Energy, and Vitality
outline: 1 Corinthians 6:19-20: Understanding the body as a resource for Kingdom work.
The link between physical vitality and spiritual endurance in the coaching journey.
Stewardship of Mental Energy: Managing cognitive load and emotional capacity.
Developing sustainable habits for nutrition, movement, and sleep as spiritual disciplines.
Coaching clients through burnout: Identifying when 'stewardship' has turned into 'striving'.

lessons.title: Overcoming Barriers: Procrastination, Sloth, and Fear
outline: Identifying the spiritual and psychological roots of procrastination and 'Acedia' (spiritual sloth).
The Fear of Failure vs. The Fear of Success: How both hinder faithful stewardship.
Cognitive Reframing: Shifting from 'I have to' to 'I get to' in the stewardship process.
The role of the Holy Spirit as the 'Helper' in developing self-discipline (Galatians 5:22-23).
Strategies for overcoming 'Decision Fatigue' and task paralysis.

lessons.title: Financial Stewardship and Kingdom Generosity
outline: Biblical principles of provision, debt, and financial freedom for service.
Aligning the budget with the calling: Ensuring money serves the client's God-given mission.
The Psychology of Scarcity vs. The Theology of Abundance in financial coaching.
Cultivating a 'Generosity Mindset': Stewardship as a means to bless others.
Practical tools for tracking financial stewardship without falling into legalism.

lessons.title: Accountability Systems for Sustainable Stewardship
outline: Defining Biblical Accountability: 'Iron Sharpening Iron' (Proverbs 27:17) in the coaching relationship.
Designing personalized accountability structures that empower rather than shame.
Measuring Progress: Using 'Kingdom Metrics' to track growth in stewardship.
The Power of the 'Well Done' Milestone: Celebrating faithful management of small things.
Transitioning from Coach-led accountability to self-stewardship and community support.

lessons.title: The Biblical Foundation of Transformation
outline: Defining Metamorphoo: Exploring the Greek root of transformation in Romans 12:2.
Distinguishing between secular behavior modification and Holy Spirit-led inner transformation.
The role of the coach as a facilitator of the Holy Spirit’s work rather than a 'fixer.'
Biblical archetypes of transformation: Analyzing the radical shifts in Peter and Paul.
Understanding the 'New Creation' mandate (2 Corinthians 5:17) as the starting point for change.

lessons.title: Cognitive Renewal: The Battle for the Mind
outline: The mechanics of 'renewing the mind': How biblical truth replaces ingrained lies.
Identifying and dismantling 'un-biblical' thought patterns and cognitive distortions.
Practical coaching tools for 'taking every thought captive' (2 Corinthians 10:5).
The intersection of neuroscience (neuroplasticity) and the biblical promise of mental renewal.
Developing a 'Scripture-First' filter for processing daily life challenges.

lessons.title: Building Faith-Driven Habits
outline: The anatomy of a habit: Cue, Routine, and Reward through a spiritual lens.
Identifying 'Keystone Habits' for the Christian life: Prayer, Scripture meditation, and Service.
Overcoming the 'Willpower Gap' by relying on Divine Grace rather than self-effort.
Designing 'Micro-Steps' to ensure sustainable, long-term spiritual and practical growth.
Coaching the client through the 'Habit Loop' to replace old triggers with faith-based responses.

lessons.title: Navigating the 'Valley of Change'
outline: Understanding the emotional cycle of change: From uninformed optimism to informed pessimism.
Identifying common spiritual and psychological resistance points in the transformation process.
Strategies for coaching through setbacks, 'relapses,' and the desire to return to Egypt.
The 'Long Obedience' concept: Encouraging perseverance when progress feels slow.
Biblical comfort for the 'in-between' stage of being no longer who you were but not yet who you will be.

lessons.title: Dismantling Spiritual Strongholds
outline: Recognizing persistent patterns and 'fortresses' that resist standard coaching interventions.
The theology of 'putting off the old self' and 'putting on the new' (Ephesians 4:22-24).
Coaching through 'Identity-Based' change vs. 'Outcome-Based' change to ensure heart-level shifts.
Distinguishing between coaching needs, clinical needs, and the need for pastoral deliverance.
The power of confession and repentance as tools for breaking transformative barriers.

lessons.title: Holistic Integration and Lifestyle Design
outline: Aligning physical, emotional, and spiritual health for comprehensive transformation.
Creating 'Grace-Based' schedules that prioritize rest, Sabbath, and spiritual vitality.
Environmental design: Structuring the client's physical and social world to support their new identity.
Managing the ripple effect: How personal transformation impacts family, work, and community dynamics.
Setting healthy boundaries to protect the 'new growth' from toxic influences.

lessons.title: Accountability and the Body of Christ
outline: The biblical mandate for community in sustaining transformation (Hebrews 10:24-25).
Designing the 'Grace-Accountability Matrix': Balancing high support with high challenge.
Coaching the client to build an 'Ecosystem of Growth' beyond the coaching relationship.
Defining the coach’s role vs. the local church’s role in the client's ongoing sanctification.
Tools for peer-to-peer accountability that focus on heart-change rather than just checklists.

lessons.title: The Transformation Roadmap and Graduation
outline: Synthesizing the C.H.R.I.S.T. journey into a long-term, sustainable growth plan.
Defining 'Kingdom Success': Measuring fruitfulness and character over mere productivity.
Preparing the client for the 'Post-Coaching' phase: Self-coaching and Holy Spirit dependency.
The Ritual of Celebration: Marking milestones and giving God the glory for the transformation.
Finalizing the 'New Life Roadmap' as a living document for future development.

modules.title: L1 Deep Dive Module 7: The Stewardship Pillar

lessons.title: The Theology of Stewardship in Christian Coaching
outline: Defining Biblical Stewardship: Moving from ownership to divine management
The Parable of the Talents: Analyzing the coach's role in resource multiplication
The 'S' in C.H.R.I.S.T.: How Stewardship bridges Revelation and Transformation
Stewardship of the Soul: Prioritizing internal health as the foundation for external action
The Coach as a Co-Steward: Helping clients manage the 'entrusted' life

lessons.title: Auditing God-Given Resources: Time, Talent, and Treasure
outline: Conducting a 'Spiritual Resource Inventory' with clients
Time Stewardship: Aligning the calendar with the client's calling
Identifying Latent Talents: Uncovering buried gifts through deep questioning
Financial Stewardship as a Spiritual Discipline: Coaching through monetary barriers
Energy Management: Stewardship of the physical temple for spiritual output

lessons.title: Bridging Revelation and Action: Crafting Faith-Based Strategies
outline: The Transition Point: Moving from divine 'Rhema' to practical 'Action'
SPIRIT Goals: Adapting SMART goals to include Spiritual alignment and Intercession
The Role of Obedience: Strategy as an act of worship and trust
Prioritization Frameworks: Distinguishing between 'Good' opportunities and 'God' assignments
Case Study: Converting a spiritual revelation into a 90-day stewardship plan

lessons.title: Overcoming the Enemies of Stewardship: Procrastination and Sloth
outline: The Biblical Root of Procrastination: Fear, perfectionism, or spiritual resistance?
Spiritual Sloth (Acedia): Recognizing and coaching through 'soul-weariness'
Practical Diligence: Implementing the 'Rule of Three' for daily focus
The 'Well Done' Motivation: Shifting client focus from results to faithfulness
Tools for overcoming distractions in a digital age

lessons.title: Boundary Setting as a Stewardship Discipline
outline: The Theology of 'No': Protecting the client’s primary calling from 'mission creep'
Sabbath Stewardship: Coaching clients toward restorative rest as a strategy
People-Pleasing vs. God-Honoring: Setting boundaries with difficult relationships
The Capacity Audit: Helping clients recognize their finite limits in an infinite God
Scriptural precedents for boundary setting in the life of Christ

lessons.title: Managing Opportunities: Discerning the 'Good' from the 'God'
outline: The 'Open Door' Fallacy: Not every opportunity is a divine invitation
The Discernment Filter: Evaluating opportunities against the 'I' (Identity) phase
The Cost of the 'Yes': Calculating the stewardship trade-offs of new commitments
Coaching through the 'Fear of Missing Out' (FOMO) from a biblical perspective
Frameworks for decision-making under pressure

lessons.title: Strategic Planning with the Holy Spirit
outline: The 'Wait and Work' Balance: Integrating prayer into the planning process
Building Flexible Frameworks: Allowing for 'Divine Interruptions' in strategic plans
Vision Documenting: Habakkuk 2:2 application in the coaching session
The 12-Month Stewardship Roadmap: Long-term planning with eternal perspective
Monitoring Progress: Using spiritual milestones rather than just KPIs

lessons.title: Accountability Structures for Long-Term Faithfulness
outline: The Biblical Model of Accountability: Iron sharpening iron (Proverbs 27:17)
Creating 'Action Covenants': Formalizing client commitments in the Stewardship phase
The Grace-Based Review: Assessing progress without falling into legalism
Building a Support Ecosystem: Helping clients find community for sustainable growth
Celebrating Stewardship: Marking milestones of faithfulness and fruitfulness

lessons.title: Foundations of the C.H.R.I.S.T. Coaching Method™
outline: Defining the distinction between secular life coaching and the C.H.R.I.S.T. biblical framework.
The role of the Holy Spirit as the 'Primary Coach' in the tripartite relationship.
Biblical mandates for coaching: Encouragement, exhortation, and edification.
Overview of the six pillars: Connection, Heart-Search, Revelation, Identity, Stewardship, and Transformation.
Establishing the ethical and spiritual prerequisites for the L1 Certified Christian Life Coach.

lessons.title: Pillar C: Connection and Covenant Partnership
outline: Moving from professional contracts to spiritual 'Covenant Partnerships'.
The theology of presence: Building trust through spiritual hospitality and active listening.
Practical techniques for spiritual alignment and opening sessions with prayer.
Establishing boundaries that honor the client's autonomy and God's sovereignty.
Assessing client readiness for the deep-dive coaching process.

lessons.title: Pillar H: Heart-Search and Identifying Strongholds
outline: The biblical psychology of the heart: Understanding Proverbs 20:5 in a coaching context.
Identifying 'Spiritual Strongholds' and limiting beliefs that hinder growth.
The art of the 'Deep-Dive Question': Moving past symptoms to root motivations.
Distinguishing between psychological barriers and spiritual resistance.
Creating a safe space for confession, vulnerability, and heart-level honesty.

lessons.title: Pillar R: Revelation and Seeking Divine Clarity
outline: Transitioning from human logic to divine revelation during the coaching session.
Using Scripture as a mirror: Integrating biblical truth to provide situational clarity.
Discernment protocols: Distinguishing God's voice from internal 'noise' or cultural influence.
The 'Silent Pause' technique: Incorporating moments of listening prayer into sessions.
Validating client insights against the character and Word of God.

lessons.title: Pillar I: Identity and Positional Authority
outline: The theology of 'In Christ': Helping clients internalize their new creation reality.
Dismantling identity-based lies: Overcoming labels, past failures, and performance-based worth.
Affirming spiritual authority: Empowering clients to walk in their God-given purpose.
Tools for identity mapping: Aligning personal strengths with spiritual giftings.
The 'Identity Statement' exercise: Crafting a biblical manifesto for the client's life.

lessons.title: Pillar S: Stewardship and Faith-Driven Strategy
outline: The Parable of the Talents as a coaching framework for resource management.
